ACCOMPLICE.Definition: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong

ACCUSER.Definition: a person who claims that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind

ALCOHOLISM.Definition: the condition of being an alcoholic, dependent on alcohol

ANATOMICAL.Definition: relating to the scientific study and representation of the physical body and how its parts are arranged

ARISTOCRAT.Definition: a class of people who hold high social rank

AT LARGE.Definition: a person who is at large is not in prison

AWARENESS.Definition: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing

BOOM.Definition: an increase in something, or a time when something becomes more popular

BROTHELS.Definition: a place where people go and pay to have sex with prostitutes

CIRCULATION.Definition: the number of people that a newspaper or magazine is regularly sold to

COMMONPLACE.Definition: happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special

CONCLUSIVE.Definition: proving that something is TRUE, or ending any doubt

DETAINED.Definition: to force someone officially to stay in a place

DISGUST.Definition: to make someone feel annoyed, upset, or ill about something

ECCENTRIC.Definition: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

EMBELLISHED.Definition: (of a story) made it sound more interesting by adding details that are not true

EVADE.Definition: to avoid or escape from someone or something

EXTRADITE.Definition: to make someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal

GET AWAY WITH.Definition: to succeed in avoiding punishment for something

GRUESOME.Definition: extremely unpleasant and shocking, and usually dealing with death or injury

HEIGHT.Definition: the time when a situation or event is strongest or most full of activity

INFLUX.Definition: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

IT'S TELLING.Definition: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks

JAIL.Definition: a place where criminals are kept to punish them for their crimes, or where people accused of crimes are kept while waiting for their trials

METHODOLOGY.Definition: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

NONE THE WISER.Definition: to be none the wiser also means to not be aware of something

PATROLLED.Definition: (especially of soldiers or the police) to go around an area or a building to see if there is any trouble or danger

PERSECUTION.Definition: the treatment of someone unfairly or cruelly over a long period of time because of their race, religion, or political beliefs

PERUSE.Definition: to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in

POINT THE FINGER.Definition: to say that someone should be blamed or is guilty of something

POSTED BAIL.Definition: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial

PREVENTATIVE.Definition: intended to stop something before it happens

RIFE.Definition: if something unpleasant is rife, it is very common or happens a lot

SADISTIC.Definition: a person who gets pleasure, sometimes sexual, by being cruel to or hurting another person

SEIZED UPON.Definition: to use or bring attention to something for your advantage

SUPPOSED.Definition: believed by many people to be true, but not proven and often doubted by the person who is speaking or writing

TO NO AVAIL.Definition: without any success or any effect

TRAUMATIZED.Definition: severely shocked and upset in a way that causes lasting emotional pain

VICINITY.Definition: the area around a place or where the speaker is

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
